Text.Page: Report to {@LinkCreature:248#2001#Tamur} at Khanovar Citadel for priority redeployment.

Hazto requested that you collect Sarjalod Components.

He also asked if you could recollect the bodies or any belongings of the dead soldiers.

You met a survivor, and with his help, you found the Argon Magister controlling the cannons.

Job well done, soldier.

It's a relief that the Siege Weapon works.

But I'm afraid that won't be enough to stand against their cannons.

To prevent further losses, we tried to incapacitate their cannons, but failed every time.

We need your help. Talk to {@LinkCreature:248#1032#Hazto} for details. He's out in the courtyard.
Although we're developing new weapons, the argons aren't just sitting idle.<NEXTPAGEBUTTON>"So I've noticed."</NEXTPAGEBUTTON>
I want you to kill the shapers controlling their new sarjalod cannons, and bring me back a component from one of those cannons. We have to learn their weaknesses.

It's you! I've heard so much about you.

That cannon killed all my friends...I'll do whatever it takes to bring that thing down."It's too dangerous by yourself."

Three soldiers under my command died yesterday, and I want to recover their unit insignias for their families.

Jared, Genevieve, and Misha deserved better, but I won't let their names be lost to the winds.

But it's all I can do to hold this position. I can't fight my way through to their bodies. Think you can recover them for me?
(Misha's insignia is cut in half, but still legible.)
(You find Jared's insignia, but something else catches your eye.)<NEXTPAGEBUTTON>"What's this?"</NEXTPAGEBUTTON>

Thanks. I tried to keep the argons busy. Hope you didn't get too banged up.

I found out that an argon called the Magister controls the cannon.

It was like...the cannon was linked to their body or something."The Magister?"

A special type of Argonâ€”vicious and cunning.

But they've got the components we need. I firmly believe that you can take them. Please get them for the sake of my men.

That was no mean feat, . Well done.

With those shapers dead, the cannons will sit silent for a while. Hopefully, that'll give me time to analyze its design.

The shapers never venture out without minions to protect them.

And watch out for those cannons. There's no telling what will set them off.
